Note: Blends are meant for just two people, so share your invite directly with a friend. Connected people will see your username and profile picture. They will also have the option to share this information on social platforms.

The user will lose access to some Spotify content and features, for example, purchased content and podcasts, artists and users they followed and social features like Blend.

If you switch this user to a managed account, the user’s listening history and some of their personal information will be permanently deleted. They’ll lose access to some parts of Spotify and will only be able to access their account on mobile and tablet.
After switching this account, you’ll have 7 days to undo this change.

Your favourite music in 16-bit and 24-bit high-fidelity sound
Stream wirelessly in up to 16-bit or 24-bit on compatible devices through Spotify Connect.
Lossless music in more places than ever
Look for the lossless label to signal when you’re streaming in up to 16-bit or 24-bit.
Not getting lossless? Check out our streaming pro tips and troubleshoot with a tap.
To save you data, we turn lossless on for Wi-Fi streaming only. You can adjust the audio quality for mobile streaming and downloads in Settings.
Most Bluetooth devices can play music quality better than Very High, but don’t fully support lossless sound. Lossless is best enjoyed over Spotify Connect speakers and/or wired devices.
Using Bluetooth will affect Lossless listening

"Listening in Lossless when your Settings are set to play otherwise? That's probably because you have a few songs in Lossless temporarily saved in your cache. Don't worry, no data is being used here."
This song is cached in Lossless
Songs in Lossless are larger so they use up more data when you listen via mobile streaming. To save your data, make sure you’re using Wi-Fi or change your audio quality selections in Settings.
Change your mobile data settings to save data
You set your settings to play music in Very high or less when listening via Wi-Fi and/or cellular streaming. To change this, go to Settings and select Lossless.
You set your settings to play music in Very high or less when listening via Connect. To change this, go to Settings and select Lossless.
Change your audio quality settings to stream in Lossless
The best way to listen in Lossless is with Spotify Connect. Just play a song, then tap Devices available at the bottom of the screen to select a device and control your music straight from the app.
"You're currently using Data Saver, which prevents you from being able to change your audio quality settings and listen to music in Lossless. To change this, go to Data Saver in " Settings.
Turn off Data Saver to stream Lossless

"Nothing is worse than when a song skips. That's why we automatically adjust you from Lossless to a lower audio quality if your bandwidth is poor.
You can turn off the auto-adjust quality feature in " Settings.
Change your settings to stream Lossless

"If you want to get Lossless on the go, save your data and download your songs on Wi-Fi. That way, you can listen to Lossless sound if you're offline, underground, on top of a mountain… you get the idea."

"The songs that you've downloaded aren't currently in Lossless. If you want to listen to them in Lossless, you'll need to re-download them. Just remember, Lossless song files are big and can take up a lot of storage.
You can change the audio quality of your downloads in " Settings.
Re-download your songs to play them in Lossless

"You’ve disabled the auto-adjust quality feature in Settings. This means you might experience interruptions in your listening experience when you have poor internet bandwidth.
You can turn this feature on in " Settings.
Change your settings for a smoother listening experience
Looks like your internet bandwidth is having a hard time supporting Lossless right now. Try checking your connection or switching to a different network.
To view this screen, you’ll need to go online first. Try downloading songs in Lossless so you can listen without internet in the future.
"We’re sorry, this track isn't available in Lossless yet."

We’d recommend changing your volume level to Quiet after turning on audio normalisation to avoid audio distortion (while your headphones are optimised).

Beats per minute (BPM) measures the pace of music. A high or low BPM means a fast or slow tempo, but it might sound different to your ear.
